repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

body:
Related to #3074
Allow code like the following to compile:
```cython
cimport m

def my_func():
    cdef m.CppClass.NestedClass c
```
where `m` is a module, `CppClass` is a C++ class and `NestedClass` is a nested class inside `CppClass`.

comment_data.body: Much as I like `#pragma once` in the real world, I'd rather use include guards for Cython tests. Just because they're standard
Can we put this in tests/run/cpp_nested_classes? Adding a new test adds a little more overhead than adding to a test

commit.message: Allow nested C++ classes after a module name
Merge similar tests and improve code

repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

milestone.description:
Goals:
– New version scheme: 3.x instead of 0.x.
– Change default `language_level` from `2` to `3str`.
– Change default for `binding` directive from `False` to `True`.
– Fix some Python compatibility issues (if possible, allowing for breaking changes).

title: Allow nested C++ names after a module name
